intro: Blastus tenuifolius, commonly known as the slender-leaf bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, bladder-like structures used to trap aquatic prey. This plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and wetlands. Its leaves are thin and elongated, adapted for efficient photosynthesis and prey capture. It plays a unique role in its ecosystem by contributing to nutrient cycling through its predatory behavior.
